trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents a single row of data and its metadata.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the number of columns in the data row.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of columns in the data row as an integer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxx xxx xx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the common language runtime (CLR) type value for the column specified by the column ordinal argument.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The CLR type value of the column specified by the ordinal.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx XXX xxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the common language runtime (CLR) type value for the column specified by the column name argument.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx $xx$xxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The CLR type value of the column specified by the name.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx XXX xxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the field value to start retrieving bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The target buffer to which to copy bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the buffer to which to start copying bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to copy to the buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the field value to start retrieving characters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The target buffer to copy chars to.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the buffer to start copying chars to.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of chars to copy to the buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the name of the data type for the column specified by the ordinal argument.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The column is of a user-defined type that is not available to the calling application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xx x xxxx$xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The column is of a user-defined type that is not available to the calling application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xx x xxxx$xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the value for the column specified by the ordinal as a float.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xx x $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the name of the column specified by the ordinal argument.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the column ordinal specified by the column name.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The name of the column to look up.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The zero-based ordinal of the column as an integer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx$xxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The column name could not be found.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The column is of a user-defined type that is not available to the calling application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xx x xxxx$xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The column is of a user-defined type that is not available to the calling application domain.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xx x xxxx$xxxxxxx xxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the data value stored in the column, expressed as a SQL Server type, specified by the column ordinal.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx x XXX Xxxxxx xxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the values for all the columns in the record, expressed as SQL Server types, in an array.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx XXX Xxxxxx xxxxx$ xx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array into which to copy the values column values.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the common language runtime (CLR) type value for the column specified by the ordinal argument.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The CLR type value of the column specified by the ordinal.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx XXX xxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns the values for all the columns in the record, expressed as common language runtime (CLR) types, in an array.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxxx$ xx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The array into which to copy the values column values.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns true if the column specified by the column ordinal parameter is null.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if the column is null; false otherwise.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the field value to start copying bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The target buffer from which to copy bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the buffer from which to start copying bytes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of bytes to copy from the buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the field value to start copying characters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The target buffer from which to copy chars.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The offset into the buffer from which to start copying chars.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of chars to copy from the buffer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the data stored in the column to the specified float value.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The ordinal passed in is a negative number.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets a new value, expressed as a common language runtime (CLR) type, for the column specified by the column ordinal.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx x xxx xxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx $XXX$ xxxx$ xxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The new value for the specified column.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of column values set as an integer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x
